channel.title: Cache Repacking/Unpacking Utility Help
channel.description:
Well, I've recently been trying to make my own packer/unpacker. Yes, it's VERY hard, and I'm only beginning, but hopefully I can get this through. Proof of my packer BETA: (I also got the models file to go down from 27MB big to a .idx file of only 12MB big) [img]http://i16.tinypic.com/4z2ommq.png[/img]
But the question is, how does Jagex pack their cache? I know it's not ZIP Compression (using Java), and it cant be normal GZip Compression (using Java), but what is it? When I try to use those last two types, I get invalid format errors and cannot open the cache file. So does anybody know how they compress it, or know anything to do with this?
Any help is appreciated. And please, do not spam this topic about how to pack/unpack etc.
[b]EDIT[/b]: Is there really a type of encrpytion on it?
Thanks in advance -TeleNubby

item.dc:creator: @Sane Sane
item.description:
@Sane wrote:

I figured ill help u since u started helping me i cant get me my own packer but i do kno alot of the basics they use C C+ last of what i heard as in from this… Its like a javascript offset meaning they would change programs to prevent from worldwide hack…
But yah for the most part its a compressed zip archive that they run threw the latitorial base

They use jagformat for updates

item.title: Cache Repacking/Unpacking Utility Help
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

[quote=“S C A R Bot, post:4, topic:137669”]Its RuneScript wich is a mix of Java, C, C++[/quote]Oh ;\ That’s not good. Well when I try to decompress/unpack the cache using my own inprogress unpacker, it said it’s not a valid/supported format. Any fixes for that, or any more ideas?

PM me your MSN and I can help you out alot. Unless you don't have an MSN >_>

For the most part Jagex uses a JagFormat to pack so its pretty much unknown. Like I said, MSN.


EDIT: Just remembered, your inbox has been full for like, hmm, a few months. >_>

Read full topic
